intro: Bomarea nobilis, commonly known as the noble bomarea, is a striking flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are fibrous and somewhat succulent. Bomarea nobilis is appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in shaded gardens.
